block.p: Brooke Sandra Jaffe, a daughter of Imogene and Laurence Jaffe of New York, was married last evening to Peter Anthony Scott, a son of Pamela and Henry Scott of Westport, Conn. Rabbi David M. Posner officiated at the Rainbow Room in New York, and the Rev. James Arimond, a Roman Catholic priest, participated in the ceremony.
The bride and bridegroom met at the University of Pennsylvania, from which they graduated, she cum laude.

Brooke Sandra Jaffe, a daughter of Imogene and Laurence Jaffe of New York, was married last evening to Peter Anthony Scott, a son of Pamela and Henry Scott of Westport, Conn. Rabbi David M. Posner officiated at the Rainbow Room in New York, and the Rev. James Arimond, a Roman Catholic priest, participated in the ceremony.
The bride and bridegroom met at the University of Pennsylvania, from which they graduated, she cum laude.
Mrs. Scott, 28, is the accessories editor of InStyle magazine in New York.
Her father, who is retired, was the general counsel of Washington Homes, a real estate development company in Landover, Md. Her mother is an interior designer in New York.
Mr. Scott, 27, is an associate in the real estate group of the investment banking unit at Lehman Brothers in New York.
His mother sells linens and home accessories at charity fund-raisers. His father works in Westport as a lawyer and financial adviser for foreign companies doing business in the United States.
